article: One day, four lawyers were riding along a country road. There had been a(n) _ , and the ground was soft. The lawyers rode _ , talking and laughing. As they were passing through a _ , they heard some noises in the grass. "What's the matter here?" asked one man. "Oh, it's only some old robins !" said another one, "The _ has blown them out of the nest. They are too young to _ ." "What a _ ! They'll die," said the third one. "Well! They're nothing but _ ," said the first lawyer. The three men looked down and saw the mother robin _ to her mates. Then they rode on, talking and laughing as before. In a few minutes they had forgotten about the birds. But the fourth lawyer, whose name was Abraham Lincoln, _ . He got down from his _ and gently took the little ones up. They didn't seem _ , but chirped softly, as if they knew they were safe. "Never _ , my little fellows," said Mr. Lincoln. Then he looked up to find the nest from which they had _ . It was much higher than he could reach. But Mr. Lincoln could _ . He put the birds softly, one by one, into their warm home. In a few minutes, Mr. Lincoln _ the others. He had torn his coat on the thorny tree. Then all three of them _ heartily. They thought it so _ that a strong man should take so much trouble just for some worthless young birds. "Gentlemen," said Mr. Lincoln, "I couldn't have _ tonight if I had left those helpless robins to die in the _ grass." Abraham Lincoln afterwards became President of America.
